io.dvlopt.linux.gpio

Class GpioEventWatcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.dvlopt.linux.gpio.GpioEventWatcher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class GpioEventWatcher
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Class for efficiently monitoring several GPIO events at once.

      • waitForEvent

        public boolean waitForEvent(GpioEventData data)
                     throws io.dvlopt.linux.LinuxException
        Waits forever until a GPIO event occurs.
        Parameters:
        data - Where information about the event will be written.
        Returns:
        A boolean whether something happened or not.
        Throws:
        io.dvlopt.linux.LinuxException - When something fails on the native side.

      • waitForEvent

        public boolean waitForEvent(GpioEventData data,
                            int timeout)
                     throws io.dvlopt.linux.LinuxException
        Waits `timeout` milliseconds at most until a GPIO event occurs.
        Parameters:
        data - Where information about the event will be written.
        timeout - A timeout in milliseconds where -1 means forever.
        Returns:
        A boolean whether something happend or not within the given timeout.
        Throws:
        io.dvlopt.linux.LinuxException - When something fails on the native side.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws io.dvlopt.linux.LinuxException
        Closes this instance and release associated resources.

        The previously registered GPIO event handles WILL NOT be closed.

        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        io.dvlopt.linux.LinuxException - When something fails on the native side.
